title: Simulation Learning to Overcome Cognitive Biases in Clinical Decision-Making

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical knowledge and general understanding of pedagogy
context.additional_context: Meta-learning elements incorporated for pre-service/in-service teachers, applying clinical scenarios to educational case analysis.

learning_goals: Learners can identify and explain four major cognitive biases (momentum, confirmation, probability calculation, and sequence effects) in a simulation environment.
Learners implement recovery strategies that correct over 70% of decision-making errors through critical thinking when biases occur.
During debriefing, learners engage in peer feedback and self-reflection using bias-resistant frameworks at over 80% participation.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
